title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement https://github.com/SignorinoY/survode/issues. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: goal survode implement method described Tang et al. (2022) [1] fitting survival models using ordinary differential equations. package currently development yet ready use.

title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: can install development version survode like :

title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(simsurv) library(survode) #> 载入需要的程辑包：survival  # Create a simple data set set.seed(42) cov <- data.frame(   id = 1:400,   trt = stats::rbinom(400, 1L, 0.5),   hormon = stats::rnorm(400, 0, 1) ) dat <- simsurv(   lambdas = 0.1, gammas = 1.5, betas = c(trt = -0.5, hormon = 1.0),   x = cov, maxt = 5 ) sim <- merge(cov, dat)  # Fit a Cox model with a spline for the baseline hazard fit <- survodereg(Surv(eventtime, status) ~ trt + hormon, data = sim, df = 5) fit$coefficients$beta #>        trt     hormon  #> -0.6693948  0.9394916  # Predict the baseline hazard at times (0, 5) bh <- predict(fit, type = "hazard", time = seq(0, 5, length.out = 100)) par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.85) plot(   bh$time, bh$basehaz,   type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Baseline hazard" ) lines(bh$time, 0.15 * bh$time^0.5, col = "red") plot(   bh$time, bh$cumhaz,   type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Cumulative baseline hazard" ) lines(bh$time, 0.1 * bh$time^1.5, col = "red")

title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: Please note survode project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms. [1] Tang, W. et al. (2022) ‘Survival analysis via ordinary differential equations’, Journal American Statistical Association, pp. 1–16. Available : https://doi.org/10.1080/01621459.2022.2051519.

what: Predict the baseline hazard function — predict.survodereg
title: Predict the baseline hazard function — predict.survodereg

title: Predict the baseline hazard function — predict.survodereg
code: # S3 method for survodereg predict(fit, type = "hazard", time)

title: Predict the baseline hazard function — predict.survodereg
text: fit Object class survode containing fitted model. type Type prediction. Currently "hazard" supported. time Vector times evaluate baseline hazard.

title: Predict the baseline hazard function — predict.survodereg
text: list containing following components: time Times baseline hazard evaluated. basehaz Baseline hazard estimates. cumhaz Cumulative baseline hazard estimates.

title: Ancillary arguments for controlling survode fitting — survodereg.control
Ancillary arguments for controlling survode fitting — survodereg.control
text: eps convergence criteria optimization algorithm. Default 1e-4. maxit maximum number iterations optimization algorithm. Default 100.

what: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survodereg
title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survodereg
text: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations

title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survodereg
code: survodereg(formula, data, df, degree = 3, knots = "uniform", init, control)

title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survodereg
text: formula formula object, response left ~ operator, terms right. response must survival object returned Surv function. data data frame interpret variables named formula. df number degrees freedom spline. degree degree spline. Default 3. knots knots spline, either "uniform" "quantile". "uniform", knots equally spaced 0 maximum observed time. "quantile", knots equally spaced quantiles observed times. Default "uniform". init vector initial values parameters. Default initial value zero parameters. control Object class survodereg.control containing control parameters fitting algorithm. Default survodereg.control().

title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survodereg
code: library(simsurv) library(survode)  # Create a simple data set set.seed(42) cov <- data.frame(   id = 1:400,   trt = stats::rbinom(400, 1L, 0.5),   hormon = stats::rnorm(400, 0, 1) ) dat <- simsurv(   lambdas = 0.1, gammas = 1.5, betas = c(trt = -0.5, hormon = 1.0),   x = cov, maxt = 5 ) sim <- merge(cov, dat)  # Fit a Cox model with a spline for the baseline hazard fit <- survodereg(Surv(eventtime, status) ~ trt + hormon, data = sim, df = 5) fit$coefficients$beta #>        trt     hormon  #> -0.6693948  0.9394916   # Predict the baseline hazard at times (0, 5) bh <- predict(fit, type = "hazard", time = seq(0, 5, length.out = 100)) par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.85) plot(   bh$time, bh$basehaz,   type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Baseline hazard" ) lines(bh$time, 0.15 * bh$time^0.5, col = "red") plot(   bh$time, bh$cumhaz,   type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Cumulative baseline hazard" ) lines(bh$time, 0.1 * bh$time^1.5, col = "red")
